## R Markdown
```{r datos}

library(readxl)
Datos <- read_excel("C:/Users/Gloriana/Desktop/Proyecto redes/AnÃ¡lisis/Nets.xlsx")
```

```{r assumptions, echo=FALSE}

#Verify that assumptions of normality and homoscedasticity are met (data for n individuals per sampling effort were sqrt transformed)

dat = lm(Nind_sr ~ Net, Datos)

plot(fitted(dat),residuals(dat))^2

hist(residuals(dat))

qqnorm(residuals(dat))


library(ggpubr)

ggqqplot(Datos$Nind_sr)

```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
